title: How often should I post on my blog? - Quora

response.answer_text: Look at your blog contents from a readers view point. You will realize then that broadly readers of blogs would want the following: Quality in the content - both in terms of relevance of the content as well as they style and presentation of the content.They would visit your blog if there is regularly updated quality contentNew readers would be keen to explore your blog if there is ample content to go throughSo when I first started my Inspirational and Motivational blog Actspot's Blog I kept a broad target of writing around 300–500 words every day. I must admit it was ambitious and stressful. However, by the year end I had over 300 posts. Frankly I was getting enough views to keep me motivated but then I didn’t have a target for the next year. The number of posts I managed the next year was hardly 40 posts the whole year but by then I was getting readers because of the ample content. Currently I have a target to update my blog once a week, which I am managing to do. My blog has 300,000 views and around 1280 followers. So my suggestions are: Choose the blog topic and style after great thought. Focus on what your reader would want and why she/ he should visit your blog.In the initial days write as often as possible. Maybe even twice a week but definitely once a week is a must.Ensure each blog post has appropriate content, the language and grammar are in order, and you have developed a good style to hold readers interest.Once you have ample content you can scale down your writing but ensure you continue to update the blog regularly.No one will visit your blog unless you promote it. So be disheartened if you have poor numbers in terms of views. Promote your blog after you have at least 50 - posts so that readers have ample content to appreciate your blog contents.Best Wishes

As often and frequently as you can, but not more than you should. See, it all comes down to your reader’s satisfaction. Your primary goal should be producing valuable content that you readers find useful, enjoyable and interesting enough to stay engaged. You must learn how to balance the two: Consistent Quality & Consistent Publishing Schedule, as that can prove to be the key to your blog's success in the long run. Blog regularly, but not too frequently. A few well-researched outstanding posts will take you further than just throwing out a ton of mediocre ones. The trendsetters of content marketing world like Buffer and Hubspot blog everyday. But the quality of their content is never compromised. So what should you do? Blog every day or once in a week or 2–3 times per week or once a month maybe? Whatever floats your boat! Just make sure you stick to a schedule and don’t compromise with the quality of content. [You can read this article to know why frequency is crucial in blogging : 5 reasons why blogging frequently is important for your business] Happy Blogging!

Here is the common refrain and general rule of thumb of the blogging world since the dawn of blogging 20+ years ago:— “This blog updates every Tuesday at 8 p.m.”To all intents and purposes, that means a couple of things:— one post per week — or 52 posts a yeareach post then is OC (‘original content’)OC then means high quality, which means good background research for each posteach post then is a ‘long read’ — around 700–1,500 words eachIf you’re a new or inexperienced blogger, start with one post a week — it’s actually quite a workload. I’ve been blogging for 20+ years and my blog is one of the world’s earliest (launched a few years after the world’s first website was invented in 1991/92). I’ve been blogging precisely one post a week. It earned me two awards because every post of mine is OC.

When you first start a blog, the goal is to get a decent amount of blog post up as quickly as possible. The trick is to keep up with enough consistency that you don't burn out. At the beginning I would suggest trying to blog at least twice a week period because you don't have a lot of content, it's going to be very difficult to interlink your blog articles. You also don't have a lot of content to keep people on your blog. Once you have a decent amount of posts, enough so that your ideal reader can get a sense for who you are and what you know about, then it’s OK to drop down to one blog post a week. But I wouldn’t go any lower than that. Key to all of this is the quality. At the beginning, your stuff is probably going to stink. That’s OK. We all have to start somewhere! That’s why it’s OK to start publishing frequently. Once you start to get better, you’ll realize just how much it takes to write a good post. That’s when you’ll want to drop down your posting as it’s going to take you a lot longer to get a great post up. Be persistent and blog what you love!

To an extent, Google favours ‘active’ blogs. But there’s no set formula to how much you should update your blog, or write new content. I wrote content in 2016 which continues to bring in the most traffic to my site today. My recent work hasn’t had such a big impact. Why? Well I believe there’s three main reasons the ‘old’ content works best for my site: It’s had time to organically climb the Google rankings and deliver more traffic.I’ve refined the SEO/Keyword strategy through trial and error.It’s evergreen content that won’t expire any time soon.I haven’t tried to out-do my competition by making frequent posts. I just focus on keeping the content up-to-date, and ensuring that it’s of high quality. It works for my blog (see Punter2Pro). Granted, many niches thrive by producing content that’s current. For instance, weekly podcasts about the latest sports news, rumours and results. They’re fuelled by recent events. Even if your blog requires up-to-date content, I personally wouldn’t fixate on the frequency of your posts. The quality of our content, how you market it, and how it performs SEO-wise is more likely to dictate it’s success. Learn more: Search Engine Optimisation Secrets Exposed -- Top 12 SEO Tips Long-term "Evergreen" vs Short-term Content How To Write Great SEO-Friendly Content For Your Website

There is no hard or set rule for making a blog post. I have some blogs that I have not posted to in years simply because they are not a priority. I have other sites, that could be considered blogs, that I post to at least weekly (https://fourstatesnews.us) and still others that I post to once a month or so. From SEO experts, they usually say post at least one new post each week to maintain your SEO level. If being at the top of search engines is your goal, then I would post at least weekly. If you have a specialty blog, like my Commodore Computers blog (http://commodorecomputers.us) then you may have a post every month or so. The best advice I have heard is to post at least weekly for good search engine results, enjoy what you post, and have fun. If your goal is to make money with a blog, then you need a lot of advertising and the kind of post that draws readers no matter how frequently you post. If your goal is to have fun or reach a specific group of people, then set your own goals and your own deadlines and don’t worry about what other people say!

One, two or three posts per week is usually better. As a blogger, posting once or twice a week is a good practice. The benefit of posting a blog once or twice a week is that you can think on the particular topic in depth so the outcome of the blog that you get is also good. It will increase the reader's engagement on your site. Always make sure the following points while posting a blog once or twice a week, Look at which content on your blog is most popular, so you can make every single post a successful one.Experiment with longer posts, perhaps 1,000+ words.Always try to focus on evergreen content, so that each post will stay relevant for years.Don’t change things too abruptly: try going from five posts per week to three posts per week, for instance.Consider surveying your readers to find out whether they’d like more or fewer posts.Experiment with writing posts ahead of time, or with creating a content calendar.I hope the mentioned information is sufficient for you. Thank you!

I’ll assume you’re asking this question because you want to drive a decent traffic to your blog within a reasonable time. Based on that assumption, here’s my answer… As a beginner blogger, the most important thing for you is not the number of post you’re updating on a weekly basis. The problem you solve with your content and the reach you’re able to have are more important when it comes to getting a decent traffic for your new blog. So before getting started, you’ll want to ask yourself, what length of post can i write to bring out real value for my readers. And what duration of time can i spend to research and write this post. The answer here will guide you as regards the amount of time you’ll spend to write a single post and this will decide the duration of time you’ll allocate to writing blog posts per week on your blog. In a nutshell, at least 2–3 posts per week is good for a beginner on a non news blog. Also Remember, networking, guest posting and social media sharing are also very important drivers of traffic and engagement back to your website. These should also be included in your weekly posting plan.

As long as you’re producing relevant, interesting, valuable content … Blog once a day.If you can’t blog once a day, blog every other day.If you can’t blog every other day, blog once a week.If you can’t blog once a week, blog once a month.And if you can’t blog once a month, well, you probably shouldn’t be blogging. Find another channel to promote yourself or your business.Again, the key here is to consistently produce content that’s going to be valuable to your audience. Don’t blog every single day if you don’t have great content every single day. At the end of the day, it comes down to this: Blog as often as you can, but no more than you should.

How often do you want to update your blog? What's your niche? How involved are your posts?  There are so many variables to the answer to this question that I really couldn't possibly give you a concrete answer.  But what I can tell you is this - quality of your post matters more than quantity of posts. There are well known, successful bloggers who blog once a week, or even once a month. There are others who post every day.  The real question is how often can you post high quality, high value posts? How often can you create an article that is actually worth someone taking the time to read? That's how often you should post.  Don't get stuck with the idea that "ok, it's Monday, I have to get a post up because it's Monday".   And remember - at least 3/4 of your time should be spent on promotion. Until you've got some readers coming to your blog, creating a lot of content doesn't do much good because there's no one to see it.  You're better off creating five or six AMAZING posts, then marketing the hell out of them to build up a readership. Once you do have some readers and a few people signed up to your email list, then it becomes important to be consistent. Once a week, twice a week, twice a month - just be consistent so your readers know what to expect.  You can click here to see what else I had to say about it -How Often Should You Update Your Blog?

I’d say as much as you can put out high quality and interesting posts that your readers enjoy. If you can only do that once every other week, then do that. If you’ve got tons of free time and energy and can post twice a week do it. But I personally think it’s way more about quality over quantity, there are a lot of bad posts out there because people think they need to push something out. They don’t. If you write great stuff it doesn’t matter how often you write it, people will read. Whatever you do choose, I think it’s important to write consistently. If its every other week, make sure that’s in your schedule. If it’s once a month, make sure that is in your schedule. Just set a time on your calendar and go with it.

Honestly, the number of times one ought to blog is not specific it just so depends on one's schedule and value being given. Some top blogs, blog about 2-3 times per week and it keeps them going plus this routine they've got used to over the years and it has in so doing helped their site traffic too. The question about how often you got to blog, is a personal thing. You could choose to blog 7days a week with say 400words a piece or 1,2,3,4 or even 5 times a week with at least 600-700wrd pieces that gives value. Nonetheless, if you can keep up to it (blogging 600-700wrds per week consistently), then go with it. The most important thing is that you have fun while blogging to EXpress yourself and not IMpress. So, my dear have fun. Hope this will do. Top Blog Submission Sites With High Domain Authority of 40+

That's a good question. There's no right answer as far as frequency goes. I've seen suggestions that range from 1 day to 5 days a week. The variety of solutions tells you that there is no magic number. Instead of focusing on frequency, you should focus on providing quality, helpful content. One high-quality post will benefit you much more than ten mediocre posts. Quality, helpful content answers a question or helps people solve a problem. It'll increase the chance of your blog getting noticed. It also makes it more likely that readers will engage with you through comments. Finally, quality content increases the likelihood other bloggers will link to your post. These all help your SEO. The bottom line is that you want to work hard to establish your blog's authority. Quality content does more for that than quantity ever will. So, you should focus on quality.

There's no specificity to that but it balls down to why you are blogging and who you are trying to reach. Dedication / Hard Work is the only key through which you can be focused and need to show up while doing / starting a professional Blog. Being a Professional Blogger, will suggest you to start focusing on basics and improve skills , levels by levels. Don’t take any coaching because all will give only theoretical knowledge. Just go on this big deep internet and be a perfectionist. To keep your blog updated and alive on weekends, you can use schedule ahead feature to harness the weekend traffic. If the content on your blog is fast moving, like news based articles, recipes, Do it yourself techniques and projects, anything revolving around kids, etc, you need to keep it updated every day, even on weekends.If your blog is about travel, an experience, review or fashion, you can update it as soon as you have gained knowledge by experiencing products.If your blog is about general articles, poems or life related and behavioral articles, it is best to keep it updating like a column, every 4–5 days without miss and coming out with a relevant, new and fresh topic everytime.

This is a very common question among newbie bloggers, and there's no definite answer to this question.  If you plan on ranking on Google and other search engines, then it's important to always have fresh and updated content on your blog. At minimum I would suggest making one post per week. This will keep your content fresh and will show Google you regularly update your blog. If you want better results faster, I recommend trying to get at least 3 to 4 new blog posts up every week. If you don't have time to write, you can always use a service such as iWriter: Content & Article Writing Service to get someone else to write articles and blog posts for you.

That totally depends if you are doing it out of a passion or for business/job purpose. If you are doing it out of passion, you could write as regular as you want to; making sure you express what ever you are willing to. If you are writing for other mentioned purpose try to maintain and build a routine and follow it strictly. There are no hard and fast rules about how often you should. You can blog after every 3 days or every week, but consistency is the key.  But to make it specific try blogging at least every 3rd day as people want new content every now and then. This way you would even have enough time to promote your blog and plan for your next blog post.

How often you blog is up to you. It depends in part on the purpose of your blog. I have been writing every day for ten years now at Ennyman's Territory, but you have to have motivation to do that. How often you post on a blog is also determined by your philosophy as regards word counts. Some bloggers insist that posts should be 2000 words or more to get high ranking on Google. If you make 2000 words your standard, I guarantee that you will not write a post every day, at least not for ten years. So, how frequently should you blog? Again, it’s up to you. For best results, create a plan you’re comfortable with, that fits your lifestyle. (Assuming this is a personal blog we’re discussing.) Good luck.

How often do you want to blog? There is no one size fits all but will depend on your subject, your audience and whether blogging is your primary activity or something you do in addition to a full time job. I write enough to post twice a week anywhere from 500 to 7500 words per single post and depending on the subject. I have written longer post but have broken them at the 2 to 3 k words to make sure my audience stays on target. I write about web and publishing technologies. My writing can go faster or slower as I also research the subject and write code to go with most posts. I also schedule posts in advance as they are written. That way I don’t have to remember to do it on the day and can see how much I’ve written and whether I can take a break or not :) Whatever you decide stick with it. If you decide to post once a week you can post more often but never less. That’s the quickest way to loose your audience.

The quick answer is always: the more you blog, the more you get traffic. Actually there are more variables to take in count, like the quality of your posts and the time you have to write them: it is better to write 2 high quality articles a week than 10 low quality ones. It depends also on which kind of blog you’re running (e.g. fashion vs technology vs food, etc…) and how much you’re famous. I’ve seen famous bloggers just publish 1 article a week… sometimes just not even that. As a rule of thumb, if you’re starting, my advice is around 3 articles a week. But, as I’ve said, it depends.

There is no universal “right” blog frequency. You have to do what works best for your business. There are a few things to keep in mind. First, no matter how often you decide to post, it’s important to be consistent. You shouldn’t post just when you feel like it or “have time.” Pick a frequency and stick to it, whether it’s once a day, once a week, once a month or once a quarter. I would say in most cases, you’d want to post once a month, at least. Second, you need to consider how often you can produce QUALITY content. Don’t just post for the sake of posting. Finally, you want to consider how often your audience wants content. If you post too often, they will get burnt out and tune out. Not often enough, and they will turn to other sources. It comes down to looking at your resources and knowing your audience.

The most important thing to bring readers back(other than great content) is a consistent schedule. You could get away with as little as one post a week as long as it is a great post and you post at the exact same time every week. If you pick Friday at 9am. You need to make sure that you are scheduling your posts to always come out on Friday at 9am. Your fans will get trained to your schedule. Sending out an email notification to let them know the new post is up will also help. Tldr; at least once a week if not more often and be consistent.

The regularity of blog posts depends on the type and requirements of a particular organization. As per the frequency of blog posts calculates, it has been observed that small scale businesses are posting on their blog more than four times a week, while the large scale businesses are posting once or twice a week. It also depends on the relevancy and quality of content. If your content is engaging and you are confident that it will hook the readers then even more blog postings are less. Some of the prominent factors one should consider while posting on the websites are: •	High-quality content •	Major focus on eye-catching headings and subheadings •	Infographics •	Generate curiosity •	Informational yet engaging content

There's no specificity to that but it balls down to why you are blogging and who you are trying to reach. There are niches it will be fine to just blog once in a week and it will okay and they are also niches you have to be there 24 hours or a member of your team will be standing in for you. Take for instance you are a news blogger, you must be there at least 18 hours everyday. In all what matters is your content marketing strategy. If you have a quality content marketing strategy, you can blog 4 times a month and still achieve a better result than someone blogging everyday. Step-by-Step Guide on How to Craft an Effective Small Business Content Marketing Strategy

According to HubSpot, companies that blog more often ( published more than 16 blogs monthly) receive 3.5x more traffic than companies who post 0-4 blogs per month.  This fact should be enough to drive home the fact that being consistent actually helps in increasing reach and visibility. As HubSpot is a leading authority in content marketing domain, I would recommend sticking to this insight and create a strategy that at least has room for 16–20 monthly blogs. Apart from traffic there are several reasons to keep blogging often when it comes to a business website. Google loves websites that are regularly updated and indexes them more often. This gives websites a chance to rank higher among search engine results. I recently penned down a detailed blog on this topic. If you want to explore more reasons and want some tips that can help you blog frequently, do give it a read.

There's no right answer here I'm afraid—you need to form a plan and stick to it.  Make sure you don't overwork yourself, though. If you do, you'll find writing becomes a chore and that'll show in your writing. You'll find you're constantly trying to catch up with yourself. Some blog authors publish multiple times a week, some once a week, others once a month, and some infrequently. If you're looking to boost your search engine rankings, I'd stick to posting at least every month. This way, you'll keep your keywords at the top of the pile and attract more clicks. Good luck!

Firstly, I don't know the genre you specifically write about. So let's consider a general scenario where you aren't posting monotonous stuff. Write as much as you can. Always carry a small notepad and pen (I feel mobile doesn't suffice) to jot down ideas as and when they strike you. Because they have impeccable timing. Creativity is not a tree that will bear sweet fruits every other day. That means posts the day after the ‘every other day'. So write on, don't keep your audience waiting for brilliance! Good luck! Do share your blog link so I can catch up reading on good things :D Btw, thanks for A2A.

There isn’t a straightforward answer to this question. The best answer would be “blog as often as it makes sense for your business”. It all comes down to the traffic, rankings, leads and sales your site is making. In some industries you can achieve this with just 1–2 articles, in others - you’ll need to blog on weekly, even on daily basis. The RIGHT QUESTION here would be “how to make my articles rank among the top Google results?” This is the thing you should be asking yourself and should try to accomplish. If you can do it by blogging once per year - awesome, congrats! If you find it more productive to write more often or even follow a writing schedule - then it’s also great. Keep following it! In a conclusion, blog as often as you find it productive for accomplishing your business goals. Hope this helps!

To become a successful blogger, you have to maintain the consistency in posting the blogs. At least one post per week is must to be recognized by search engines. Perseverance! This is very important, difficult but possible to maintain. However, if you can build habit of posting frequently, it’ll be easy to follow. If you publish one or two post(s) monthly, your readers will forget about your topics and lose their interest. Follow the principle, “Slow but steady wins the race!” No need to publish one post every single day. Don’t be so rude to yourself. Make a plan to publish a post or two weekly. Also don’t compromise with the quality of your posts to increase the quantity. Not necessarily all of your blog posts need to be of 2000 words, it may be of 600 words only. But it should be informative and useful for your readers. This will build trust in your reader’s mind.

If you are just launching your blog, it is a good idea to fill it with a good amount of content (say 10 to 15 posts) to keep new visitors engaged. After you have established that base for your blog, the most important thing is that you keep consistent with your posting. It does not matter if you publish only twice a month as long as you do not miss any publishing date. That way your readers will know when to come back for new content. The frequency entirely depends on the niche of your blog and the engagement you have with your audience. On average, I publish two articles a week on most of my blogs.

I post daily. If you can, it does benefit your traffic to have consistent and fresh content on your blog for readers to peruse. But, it depends on your niche, your knowledge, and your time. The key isn’t so much the amount of content as the quality and consistency. If you reliably post multi-thousand word articles every Monday, it might benefit you more than a 200 word post every day. As a gaming blogger I have millions of titles I can exploit for easy blog posts, depending on your niche that may not be possible.

First of all, you need to be honest with yourself about how much time you have to write posts in your blog. If you can write every day consistently, without fail, then do so. If you can manage only once a week on a regular basis, then make that your plan. If you can realistically only cope with once a fortnight, make sure you do this without falling off the wagon. The real answer is as many times you can manage consistently. Blogging will succeed if you keep to a pattern and stick steadfastly with it. Doing a load of content one week and then nothing for a while afterwards will be detrimental for your blog.

Actually it depends upon what type of blogger you are If it provides information and stuff like news update it needs to get updated daily, If it provides some kind of story (story teller blogs) then whenever you feel like writing it should be updated, No time limit for that but still as being a blogger i recommend to update it monthly atleast so your followers don't feel like they are forgetting your blog posts!( :P ) If it's your story telling blogs then i would suggest you to write only when you feel like…

No more than necessary, no less than necessary. How’s that? Okay, on a serious note. Find out what your audience wants and give it to them. It’s really that simple, in concept. How do you know? ASK. Offer a survey and just ask that question. Short of that, it’s safe to say you can post a LOT (like multiple times per day), provided your quality is good and people want to read it. Nobody is going to think, “Oh, man, this guy posts too much.” Okay, they might, but it’s like chocolate chip cookies or pizza: You really can’t get enough if the quality is there, the price is right, it doesn’t make me sick, and I have the capacity to keep consuming it.

The more the better. But keep it high quality, a single rich content article is better than five low quality articles. In terms of the minimum, one article per week will do. However, you should really post as often as possible. Why? More content = more traffic. Search engines like sites that are regularly updated, it provides a small boost to your SEO. Don’t make articles just for the sake of it, though.

Blogging as often as possible (at least once a day) - it will give an additional traffic and visibility in GSR. SEO of site, visibility and traffic will influence on Domain (DR) and Page Ranking (PR) of your Blog. When you will achieve high DR, you will be able to use your Blog in commercial goals, for example as a tool to place an advertisement of other companies as well as providing Guest blogging services.

I believe blogging frequency is a personal preference and depends on the goals you have set for the blog. I post a new blog post once a week, but now with summer here I am posting every other week. I have my blog posts scheduled on Twitter so every 10 hours an old post is being shared. The combination of social media coverage and sharing as well as writing for the blog can be time consuming. It’s good to set goals and follow the plan.

The answer is a lot simpler than you think. As often as you can be consistent.  If you can update your blog once a week for the next week but only once every couple of weeks for the next few weeks after that then you might want to stick to updating it once every two weeks instead. The trick to successful scheduling is to make sure you're consistent with your posts.

Its totally depends on your capability to write quality content because quality matters a lot when it comes to get more visitors as well as high ranks in search engine result pages. you should create quality and fresh content for your blog consistently in order to keep your readers engaged. If you can write and publish 2 posts a week, you should carry it on without losing the quality and number of posts per week as you are doing.

To keep your readers engaged, you should try to publish as often as you can, and do so without sacrificing quality! Aiming to post at least once or twice a week is an ideal goal to encourage a regular following. *Consistency is key in order to establish a regular core of readers and to build brand loyalty. Also, posting more often is generally better for capturing the most traffic.

There is no ground rule available for this. As readers are more interested in latest and updated contents it is recommeded to update blog regularly.There are many successful bloggers who publish content once in a month,whereas a few others publish content once in a week.The quality of the content matters more than the frequency.So based on your content readiness you could choose a schedule.

During the first weeks don't post your writings on a daily basis. This is because it's too early for search engines to index your blog. Posting three posts a week would be alright. If you are consistent you will receive traffic though not much until your blog turns to 6-months old. This is minimum time. Some blogs take up to a year to receive a good never of viewers.

It’s always a good idea to be consistent with blogging if you want to engage your audience and have them coming back for more. Typically once a week is regarded as a standard but you can go for twice a week, once every two weeks or once a month as long as you are putting quality content out there.

I ‘blog’ all the time. Each time I answer a question here, I decide, should I or shouldn’t I share it to my Facebook Account, my Twitter Account, my Linked In Account, my Wordpress Account, my Huffington Post Account, my Google Blogger Account and my Google Plus Account. And I have more readers, listeners and viewers than there are people on Earth. So even aliens like my broadcasts.

Publishing daily or at least weekly is best if you want to build up an engaged following. I set up The Steeple Times in 2012 and we’ve published every day since. We generally have around 5 stories per day and have a daily newsletter that goes out on email also.

Luckily there is no restriction for this, you can post as much as you can but you need to understand it very well first that a quality articles requires a time ,for creating a unique articles you need 2 or 3 days minimum to decide about your low completion keywords and nicheNext 2 or 3 days you'll be spending like in main body content writing.Next 2 or 3 days you need for wrapping up with intro, conclusion, facts and figures etcSo this is obvious an dukh can calculate that except from some circumstances no one can write a unique content of 1000 words before a week. I blog twice a week. I think that’s the minimum. My posts are over 1,000 words, sometime closer to 2,000. I used to own a different site where I posted much shorter, pithier articles (almost gossip) twice a day. So that’s my experience. You’ll do better the more times you post. Folks who follow you and like what you post want content often
